title: Atomic Habits
author: James Clear
description: A guide to building good habits and breaking bad ones with proven strategies for lasting behavior change.

title: The Alchemist
author: Paulo Coelho
description: An inspiring tale of a young shepherd named Santiago who follows his dreams in search of treasure and self-discovery.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: A classic novel exploring racial injustice, moral growth, and compassion in the Deep South through the eyes of a child.

author: George Orwell
description: A dystopian masterpiece depicting a totalitarian regime that controls every aspect of its citizens' lives.

title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a F*ck
author: Mark Manson
description: A counterintuitive approach to living a good life by embracing limitations, challenges, and values that truly matter.

title: The Pragmatic Programmer
author: Andrew Hunt and David Thomas
description: A must-read for software developers focusing on craftsmanship, best practices, and continuous improvement.

title: Becoming
author: Michelle Obama
description: A deeply personal memoir by the former First Lady of the United States, reflecting on her journey, challenges, and triumphs.

title: Sapiens: A Brief History of Humankind
author: Yuval Noah Harari
description: An exploration of the history of humanity from the Stone Age to the modern era, blending science, history, and philosophy.

title: The Midnight Library
author: Matt Haig
description: A thought-provoking story about choices, regrets, and the infinite possibilities of life between life and death.

title: Deep Work
author: Cal Newport
description: A book about focusing without distraction in a world full of noise, helping you achieve better productivity and purpose.
